Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: gnafsika
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this small hotel for four days and didn't regret at all. Our room was a bit small -as already mentioned by previous visitors, neverthless clean and with a spacious bathroom. The breakfast was included in our booking price and proved to be a good deal. The location is perhaps one of the best things about the hotel (metro station is less than 5 minutes walking distance, bus station is just around the corner, taxis are just opposite to the hotel). This way, you can go to most of the places very easily, and at the same time avoid staying in the fussy hotels of the always busy La rampla. Finally, the reception personnel was always polite and helpful :) We would definitely suggest it to anyone who's looking for a good value for money solution.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money & location”
Reviews.Author: Hippohips
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and Mum & Dad (husband ran the marathon on Sunday). As others have reported the rooms are pretty basic but they are clean and functionable. We had a balcony that looked out on the cross roads. We were on the 5th floor (6 in total) Reception staff were very helpful. Brekfast room is tiny, we did not have a prioblem getting a table, offerings are typical european - potato tortilla was yummy and also the madira cake (well we was on holiday!!) The location suited us 10 mins to Sagrida Familia and 5 mins to metro stop -hospital de sant pau, once you are on the metro nowhere is far. For us this hotel was far enough away from the busy centre but easily accessable by metro. We bought a 4 day metro ticket that was about 22 euros (I think) we certainly got our moneys worth! There are plenty of restaurants within a few minutes walk. This was our first visit to the city and we all absolutely loved it there is so much to see and do - 5 days was not enough could have done with a couple more - we had fab weather which was an added bonus

Reviews.Title: “Just for a stop-over”
Reviews.Author: bobbysueWairarapa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated quite a distance from the city, clean but rather basic.The receptionist was very helpful regarding transport etc,our room was rather small with a balcony facing onto the street, not a marvellous view and rather noisy at night. No provision for making tea/coffee in our room - breakfast was continental and served in a small dining room. For a "sleepover" this hotel is ok, but would suggest looking further afield for better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good service, public transportation nearby...a little loud”
Reviews.Author: Irene K
Reviews.Content: Medicis Hotel is quite small with about 30 rooms. The interior is quite modern in white, red and grey. As already mentioned in the other reviews: it is indeed a bit loud. The walls are thin enough to hear your neighour snoring and his wake-up call. And not to mention, the traffic noise. The hotel is at a crossroad and near a hospital. But that is the only bad thing I can say about this hotel, since everything else was perfect! The room and the bathroom were small but very clean during our whole stay. The breakfast was simple, but always fresh and they serve Illy coffee/espresso. And the friendly staff was very helpful and committed. The location is wonderful. It is near Sagrada Familia and right in the neighbourhood of another UNESCO world heritage, the Hospital de Sant Pau. You have a very wonderful cafe/restaurant with fair prices next door that serves Tapas, Catalonian dishes and of course Chocolate con Churro. Also, you find a lot of other small joints, restaurants, bakeries, supermarkets, etc. And around the corner you have the bus station from where you can go to Parc Güell and the Catalunya Plaza (where the Ramblas start) for instance. And the metro station Sant Pau is only a short walk away and with the L5 you have direct connection to Barcelona Sants/Estacio Sants. One advice: Try booking directly on their homepage. They have great offers up to 15% discount sometimes which will not be mentioned by HRS or Expedia. All in all it's a great hotel for a Barclona vacation. Just don't forget your ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: ehsan0020
Reviews.Content: this hotel is good but bit far from city center i like it and recomended this hotel to person want to stay in barcelona with cheap price and good quality

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Kirsty D
Reviews.Content: With this hotel you get exactly what you pay for, if not more! The hotel its self is clean, modern but basic. The staff were very friendly and also very helpful especially with sight-seeing and recommending places to eat. Our room was quite small but being on a sight-seeing holiday, this did not bother us too much as we were not in it alot! The hotel is situated a little far away from the centre of Barcelona however, hotels near to Las Rambles tend to be quite expensive and so you could save a lot of money by staying in this location as it only takes 10 minutes to reach Las Rambles by metro. If you choose to stay Bed and Breakfast, be prepared, for the breakfast room is tiny! Although there is not alot of choice in the breakfast buffet, they have some lovely chocolate pastrys! My only criticism for this hotel would maybe be that it is quite loud at night so if you are a light sleeper, it would maybe be best to consider somewhere else as the walls are paper thin. Do not choose this hotel if your looking for quality, choose it if your looking for a clean room to act as a base for sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Price”
Reviews.Author: Zito55
Reviews.Content: Our family of 13 arrived a day early before our cruise and wanted a location near attractions. This was a perfect hotel. Clean and affordable including free breakfast. We could walk to La Sagrada Familia and many restaurants and shops. We loved Barcelona and will be back! Sharon Ianzito

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel shame bout the noise”
Reviews.Author: juliebaxter1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Lovely walk to Sagrada Familia past some lovely tapas ars and restaurants. Bus stop just around the corner (easy to use) and metro stop not far (again easy to use) Reception staff very friendly and helpful, advising best ways to get to all attractions. Rooms very clean and very small but with adequate storage. Only one complaint about this hotel and that is that every morning at 7 O'clock you get woken up by the cleaning staff who talk, drag furniture and generally make alot of noise with no consideration to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: svitor
Reviews.Content: A well priced (mid-range) and perfectly located hotel. Each room has a balcony, large bathroom, flat screen and a very comfortable room. The hotel is walking distance to Park Guell (25 minutes) and Sagrada Familia (7 minutes) and a little further down the road you hit Gaudi’s famous houses and La Ramblas (45 minutes). Very friendly staff and free Wi-Fi. Can’t go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: SusieWibbs
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived we were a little concerned as the hotel looks away from the centre and is only a 2 star. However this is possibly the best 2 star hotel I have ever stayed in! The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast was perfectly adequate (omelette, cheeses, hams, salamis, cereals, fruit, breads, yoghurts, pastries), the room was small but enough space for us to be comfortable, very clean bathroom. As for location, the Sagrada Familia was only 10mins walk away (we were only strolling) and there is a Metro station only 5 mins walk away which is so easy to use to get around the city. All in all this was a great little hotel and fantastic value. Only negative (and this wasn't a huge problem at all) was the thin walls - if you are a light sleeper then if might be a problem because you can hear everything from the rooms next door!

Reviews.Title: “Tint room even smaller bathroom”
Reviews.Author: veedee36
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, noisy rooms air conitioner useless, tiny bathroom, dont stay in room 102!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Garonia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near to the Sagrada Familia, and within easy reach (10-15 mins by metro/ night bus) of La Rambla. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful - definitely one of the hotel's assets. The room itself was not particularly comfortable - it was small, and the bed was very hard. But the room and bathroom were both clean, and there was no noise at all (our room looked out onto an inner area between several buildings which basically just had fire escapes in it, so the view was non existant, but there was no problem with noise). There are a few parking spaces available in a nearby indoor car park, although you have to pay extra for them - 17 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and somewhat smelly room, noisy building, good front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: TropicalTraveler78
Reviews.Content: If I had to do it over again I'd stay closer to Las Ramblas and spend a little more money. You get what you pay for 262 E for 4 nights is a good price, NO DOUBT. The room was very small but had a balcony with a decent view. But as other travelers said the building is extremely noisy and the walls and doors are paper thin. The jackhammering outside (there is road construction in the intersection that the hotel overlooks) was bone-jarring. It was reasonably clean but smelled like sewer or must when I first got there and I'm not sure why but they gave me air freshener which I used. FYI- The in room safe - they charge you 3 E per day and it is too small to fit a laptop. The desk staff really is excellent, they are bilingual and friendly and helpful. They are quick to respond to guest needs. Breakfast is indeed way overpriced and the attendant is quite bored with her job and lazy! There are other places close by that you can go to that are cheaper and better. Location is too far from the main attractions with the exception of the Sagrada Familia. Metro isn't far and Avenida Gaudi has some good places to eat. But again, you'd be better off staying closer to the city center. If you want to save money you could stay here but just know it is only one step up from a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy building”
Reviews.Author: BerlinGesundbrunnen
Reviews.Content: Very noisy building: you'll hear every door in the building slam, and every toilet flush. Not even the staff take any care to avoid loud talking outside your room when they start in the morning. Room and bathroom itself nice and comfortable. Nice blackout curtains and soundproof windows, but necessary because of street noise. Breakfast overpriced with slow and careless service. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “barcelona stop over”
Reviews.Author: sunshineSouthend
Reviews.Content: we flew into barcelona airport and went straight to our hotel by taxi, which cost 30 euros. We arrivied at the hotel about 10 oclock in the evening, to be met by a man on reception who was not particularly friendly. We were given a card for our room (102), but we were not told how to use the card. I had to stand outside the room while my partner had to go back to reception to find out how to make the card work. When we got in to the room, it was clean, just like in any pictures you may have seen. The bathroom had plenty of complimentary toiletries and lovely soft towels. Breakfast in the morning was fruit, yoghurts, cereals fresh juices only problem the milk for cereals was not cold but was warm. There is a taxi rank outside of the hotel. But we decided to get the hotel to arrange a taxi to take us to the port for our cruise. MY only critisism is that in our room the lock on the door to the balcony didnt work properly and it was on a busy, noisy road. would i stay in this hotel again YES if i was able to have a room not on the main road side.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with one unfortunate shortcoming”
Reviews.Author: spidersdad
Reviews.Content: Good, very clean hotel with excellent friendly staff in fairly central location with good public transport close by. Also free internet access. However unfortunately the air conditioning only operates for 6 months from May 1st, so if you visit outside this period as we did and the weather is unusually hot it can be stifling! The only solution was to sleep with the window wide open and we then had to put up with quite a lot of traffic noise. Everything else has a plus but this lets it down.

Reviews.Title: “BWH Medicis”
Reviews.Author: Bodlin
Reviews.Content: Well placed near Sagrada Familia, well cleaned & cute room

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Justinas_V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to metro station, therefore the city centre is few minutes away. If you prefer taxi, there are always 5 to 10 cars waiting outside the hotel. The hotel has a free wi-fi connection as well as the internet terminal. The room was ok. Has a balcony, not to much noise from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good to Rest”
Reviews.Author: Braguista
Reviews.Content: Good service, nice location (near Sagrada Familia), clean, not very expensive, but very very small room. It's quite ok for 2 or 3 days, sufficient to rest and recover for next day of sightseeing or work, The staff is very nice and tries to help.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: pk_amaya
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, modern and clean, decent beds. The room was exceptionally small I found, even by European standards, but still comfortable with a small balcony. I had read other reviews that mentioned poor sound-proofing and I thought I could handle it and surely it couldn't be THAT bad.... well, it is. You can hear every noise from the street, even people talking. I could hear the light switches in the next room being flicked on and off. The walls really are paper-thin. I would be hesitant to stay here again for that reason but at the same time the staff was great, it was clean and in a good location so maybe I would just bring earplugs next time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sound insulation”
Reviews.Author: subtarget
Reviews.Content: Location is OK, at the periphery of the city, but still only several metro stations from La Ramblas. It is a long walk changing at the Diagonal station if you want to go there, personally i recommend changing at the Sagrera station to line one. Sound insulation is absent. One morning, at 730am, we heard 2 American couples next door talking business, we were still on our beds but we heard their contract terms loud and clear. Luckily, they stays for only one night and we never heard from them since, literally. Room service and also the service at the counter were excellent. Wifi also is included. Several ants were also found in our room, which i quickly squashed. It still bothers me a bit though. Hence the three star rating in cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Northgator
Reviews.Content: I paid $71 (cdn) per night. The location was fine (only 5 metro stops from the city-centre). The service was fine. Fine places to eat around the place. I don't know why people complain about a place that only costs $71 per night. Its fine, you get for what you pay for. I received fine value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Don0256
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (late 20's / early 30's) stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is good, close to the metro and some good shopping in the area. Only a short walk to Familia Sangria which is a very touristy area full of restaurants. We spent most of our time in the Gothic Quarter and didn't really go out much near the hotel. The hotel is decent with small rooms and we did not find the room noise to be too bad. We stayed on the top floor with a balcony that seemed larger than the entire room, but it provided a great place to read and drink wine before we went out. Overall I would say this is a good home base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep- no more”
Reviews.Author: defflatfoot23
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well situated if you do not really want night life - several buses just around the corner, metro 5 min walk, near Hospital S. pau and sagarda Familia- abt 15 min walk. I had a single room - the size of a hole.( Watching the flat screen TV needs gymnastic training.) One single on each floor is squeezed in between double rooms.You can't have 2 single rooms on one floor. Bathroom needed maintenance . Breakfast was very moderate, not what I was used to from other Best Western hotels. Looking for place to just sleep at an acceptable price it isn't the worst choice.

Reviews.Title: “Go else where!”
Reviews.Author: Snufflenox
Reviews.Content: We had to stay one night in Barcelona for a cruise departing from there and after reading the reviews, decided to book at hotel Medicis. What an error! Paper thin walls, there was some potato chips and hair on the bathroom floom, the room was SMALL and breakfast... can we call that breakfast?? Go next door to the cafe! Thanks god it was only one night. Go else where!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Hotel Medicis in January 2009 for 3 nights. The hotel is located a little away from the heart of the city, but since it was close to a Metro station we didn’t really mind. The Metro stop is a few blocks away from the hotel. The hotel room itself was very small. We were accustomed to small hotel rooms in EU, but this was slightly smaller than what we were used to. However, we had a room on the 5th floor, which had a terrace almost the size of the room! But I guess only one room on the 5th floor has this, and the elevator stops on the 4th floor. That said, the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel has a nice and bright décor. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shop around. And it is also one Metro stop away from the Sagrada Familia, a famous attraction in Barcelona. (A tip about the Sagrada Familia: the entrance fee into the attraction is $12 dollars, and once we went in, all we saw was construction work!! The cathedral is much more impressive from the outside, and the outside is really what the attraction is all about. Sure there were exhibits and pictures and the history of Antoni Gaudi, but we felt it was more to compensate for the high entrance fee. Basically, you may not be missing all that much by actually going into the cathedral.) If you don’t mind staying away from the Centre, then it’s great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: thisisspain
Reviews.Content: I was amazed and delighted at the price/quality value of this hotel. I booked at the last moment and was more concerned about location than checking too much else. The price rather concerned me as I was expecting not much better than a hostel. WRONG! An excellent value hotel, 5 minutes easy walk from the metro and 10 minutes to the centre on regular spotless underground train. Walking distance to the Hospital San Pau and Sagrada Familia among other sites. The rooms are SMALL but quite adequate, Terrific bar/café next door and the hotel wifi reaches there. I had 2 excellent evenings working away in the late summer heat. It WILL be my preferred choice for Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly and well positioned near the sagrada familia”
Reviews.Author: christinejoy
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel is modest but done well.... very comfortable and safe slightly out of the central area but actually this is quite nice..... breakfast is nothing to get excited about but the illy coffee is a great way to start the day!!!! located near the sagrada familia and some lovely street cafes/restaurants..... small piece of advice.... get the train from the airport into the sants estacio and then get L5 to hospital sant pau... MUCH easier and half the cost of the bus....

Reviews.Title: “A great base for seeing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: laura_the_explorer81
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip as a package through Expedia. We were extremely satisified by this hotel. It was very clean and was in a very convenient location for the Sagrada Familia and the metro - the city centre can be reached in roughly twenty minutes. There are also some decent restaurants located close by. The lobby and rooms look to have been very recently decorated, definitely since the photos you will find on expedia were taken, very tasefully in red, white and grey. The rooms are quite compact, and I wouldn't think they would be ideal for anyone who uses a wheelchair. The bathrooms, although not so recently fitted are also extremely clean. The beds were very comfortable. Some people have noted that the walls were very thin and consequently complain of noise problems. Although we could hear quite a bit of noise during the day this was not really a problem at night, since both my husband and I quite sound sleepers! If you are a light sleeper, this is probably not the best hotel for you! The staff were very helpful and all spoke very good English. The only slight complaint I had was that on our last day, the lift was out of order and we ended up having to carry all our luggage down the stairs, which were quite narrow.... but I suppose these things can't be helped! All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good base to see the city. Barcelona in general can be quite pricey so you will save a bit by staying slightly out of town.
